refnamediv.refpurpose: A widget used to choose from a list of items

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Implemented Interfaces
refsect1.para: GtkComboBox implements AtkImplementorIface, GtkBuildable, GtkCellEditable and GtkCellLayout.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GtkComboBox is a widget that allows the user to choose from a list of valid choices. The GtkComboBox displays the selected choice. When activated, the GtkComboBox displays a popup which allows the user to make a new choice. The style in which the selected value is displayed, and the style of the popup is determined by the current theme. It may be similar to a GtkOptionMenu, or similar to a Windows-style combo box.

Unlike its predecessors GtkCombo and GtkOptionMenu, the GtkComboBox uses the model-view pattern; the list of valid choices is specified in the form of a tree model, and the display of the choices can be adapted to the data in the model by using cell renderers, as you would in a tree view. This is possible since GtkComboBox implements the GtkCellLayout interface. The tree model holding the valid choices is not restricted to a flat list, it can be a real tree, and the popup will reflect the tree structure.

In addition to the model-view API, GtkComboBox offers a simple API which is suitable for text-only combo boxes, and hides the complexity of managing the data in a model. It consists of the functions gtk_combo_box_new_text(), gtk_combo_box_append_text(), gtk_combo_box_insert_text(), gtk_combo_box_prepend_text(), gtk_combo_box_remove_text() and gtk_combo_box_get_active_text().

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_new_with_model ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkComboBox with the model initialized to model.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_wrap_width ()
refsect2.para: Returns the wrap width which is used to determine the number of columns for the popup menu. If the wrap width is larger than 1, the combo box is in table mode.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_wrap_width ()
refsect2.para: Sets the wrap width of combo_box to be width. The wrap width is basically the preferred number of columns when you want the popup to be layed out in a table.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_row_span_column ()
refsect2.para: Returns the column with row span information for combo_box.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_row_span_column ()
refsect2.para: Sets the column with row span information for combo_box to be row_span. The row span column contains integers which indicate how many rows an item should span.

listitem.simpara: A column in the model passed during construction.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_column_span_column ()
refsect2.para: Returns the column with column span information for combo_box.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_column_span_column ()
refsect2.para: Sets the column with column span information for combo_box to be column_span. The column span column contains integers which indicate how many columns an item should span.

listitem.simpara: A column in the model passed during construction

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_active ()
refsect2.para: Returns the index of the currently active item, or -1 if there's no active item. If the model is a non-flat treemodel, and the active item is not an immediate child of the root of the tree, this function returns gtk_tree_path_get_indices (path)[0], where path is the GtkTreePath of the active item.

listitem.simpara: An integer which is the index of the currently active item, or -1 if there's no active item.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_active ()
refsect2.para: Sets the active item of combo_box to be the item at index.

listitem.simpara: An index in the model passed during construction, or -1 to have no active item

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_active_iter ()
refsect2.para: Sets iter to point to the current active item, if it exists.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_active_iter ()
refsect2.para: Sets the current active item to be the one referenced by iter. iter must correspond to a path of depth one.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_model ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GtkTreeModel which is acting as data source for combo_box.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeModel which was passed during construction.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_model ()
refsect2.para: Sets the model used by combo_box to be model. Will unset a previously set model (if applicable). If model is NULL, then it will unset the model.
Note that this function does not clear the cell renderers, you have to call gtk_cell_layout_clear() yourself if you need to set up different cell renderers for the new model.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_new_text ()
refsect2.para: Convenience function which constructs a new text combo box, which is a GtkComboBox just displaying strings. If you use this function to create a text combo box, you should only manipulate its data source with the following convenience functions: gtk_combo_box_append_text(), gtk_combo_box_insert_text(), gtk_combo_box_prepend_text() and gtk_combo_box_remove_text().

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_append_text ()
refsect2.para: Appends string to the list of strings stored in combo_box. Note that you can only use this function with combo boxes constructed with gtk_combo_box_new_text().

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_insert_text ()
refsect2.para: Inserts string at position in the list of strings stored in combo_box. Note that you can only use this function with combo boxes constructed with gtk_combo_box_new_text().

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_prepend_text ()
refsect2.para: Prepends string to the list of strings stored in combo_box. Note that you can only use this function with combo boxes constructed with gtk_combo_box_new_text().

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_remove_text ()
refsect2.para: Removes the string at position from combo_box. Note that you can only use this function with combo boxes constructed with gtk_combo_box_new_text().

listitem.simpara: Index of the item to remove

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_active_text ()
refsect2.para: Returns the currently active string in combo_box or NULL if none is selected. Note that you can only use this function with combo boxes constructed with gtk_combo_box_new_text() and with GtkComboBoxEntrys.

listitem.simpara: a newly allocated string containing the currently active text.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_popup ()
refsect2.para: Pops up the menu or dropdown list of combo_box.
This function is mostly intended for use by accessibility technologies; applications should have little use for it.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_popdown ()
refsect2.para: Hides the menu or dropdown list of combo_box.
This function is mostly intended for use by accessibility technologies; applications should have little use for it.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_popup_accessible ()
refsect2.para: Gets the accessible object corresponding to the combo box's popup.
This function is mostly intended for use by accessibility technologies; applications should have little use for it.

listitem.simpara: the accessible object corresponding to the combo box's popup.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_row_separator_func ()
refsect2.para: Returns the current row separator function.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_row_separator_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_combo_box_set_row_separator_func (GtkComboBox *combo_box, GtkTreeViewRowSeparatorFunc func, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the row separator function, which is used to determine whether a row should be drawn as a separator. If the row separator function is NULL, no separators are drawn. This is the default value.

listitem.simpara: user data to pass to func, or NULL
destroy notifier for data, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_add_tearoffs ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the popup menu should have a tearoff menu item.

listitem.simpara: TRUE to add tearoff menu items

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_add_tearoffs ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current value of the :add-tearoffs property.

listitem.simpara: the current value of the :add-tearoffs property.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_title ()
refsect2.para: Sets the menu's title in tearoff mode.

listitem.simpara: a title for the menu in tearoff mode

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_title ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current title of the menu in tearoff mode. See gtk_combo_box_set_add_tearoffs().

listitem.simpara: the menu's title in tearoff mode. This is an internal copy of the string which must not be freed.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_focus_on_click ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the combo box will grab focus when it is clicked with the mouse. Making mouse clicks not grab focus is useful in places like toolbars where you don't want the keyboard focus removed from the main area of the application.

listitem.simpara: whether the combo box grabs focus when clicked with the mouse

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_focus_on_click ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the combo box grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse. See gtk_combo_box_set_focus_on_click().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the combo box grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse.

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_set_button_sensitivity ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the dropdown button of the combo box should be always sensitive (GTK_SENSITIVITY_ON), never sensitive (GTK_SENSITIVITY_OFF) or only if there is at least one item to display (GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO).

listitem.simpara: specify the sensitivity of the dropdown button

refsect2.title: gtk_combo_box_get_button_sensitivity ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the combo box sets the dropdown button sensitive or not when there are no items in the model.

listitem.simpara: GTK_SENSITIVITY_ON if the dropdown button is sensitive when the model is empty, GTK_SENSITIVITY_OFF if the button is always insensitive or GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO if it is only sensitive as long as the model has one item to be selected.

refsect2.title: The "active" property
refsect2.para: The item which is currently active. If the model is a non-flat treemodel, and the active item is not an immediate child of the root of the tree, this property has the value gtk_tree_path_get_indices (path)[0], where path is the GtkTreePath of the active item.

refsect2.title: The "add-tearoffs" property
refsect2.para: The add-tearoffs property controls whether generated menus have tearoff menu items.
Note that this only affects menu style combo boxes.

refsect2.title: The "button-sensitivity" property
refsect2.para: Whether the dropdown button is sensitive when the model is empty.

refsect2.title: The "column-span-column" property
refsect2.para: If this is set to a non-negative value, it must be the index of a column of type G_TYPE_INT in the model.
The values of that column are used to determine how many columns a value in the list will span.

refsect2.title: The "focus-on-click" property
refsect2.para: Whether the combo box grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse.

refsect2.title: The "has-frame" property
refsect2.para: The has-frame property controls whether a frame is drawn around the entry.

refsect2.title: The "model" property
refsect2.para: The model from which the combo box takes the values shown in the list.

refsect2.title: The "popup-shown" property
refsect2.para: Whether the combo boxes dropdown is popped up. Note that this property is mainly useful, because it allows you to connect to notify::popup-shown.

refsect2.title: The "row-span-column" property
refsect2.para: If this is set to a non-negative value, it must be the index of a column of type G_TYPE_INT in the model.

The values of that column are used to determine how many rows a value in the list will span. Therefore, the values in the model column pointed to by this property must be greater than zero and not larger than wrap-width.

refsect2.title: The "tearoff-title" property
refsect2.para: A title that may be displayed by the window manager when the popup is torn-off.

refsect2.title: The "wrap-width" property
refsect2.para: If wrap-width is set to a positive value, the list will be displayed in multiple columns, the number of columns is determined by wrap-width.

refsect2.title: The "appears-as-list" style property
refsect2.para: Whether dropdowns should look like lists rather than menus.

refsect2.title: The "arrow-size" style property
refsect2.para: Sets the minimum size of the arrow in the combo box. Note that the arrow size is coupled to the font size, so in case a larger font is used, the arrow will be larger than set by arrow size.

refsect2.title: The "shadow-type" style property
refsect2.para: Which kind of shadow to draw around the combo box.

refsect2.title: The "changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkComboBox *widget, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The changed signal is emitted when the active item is changed. The can be due to the user selecting a different item from the list, or due to a call to gtk_combo_box_set_active_iter(). It will also be emitted while typing into a GtkComboBoxEntry, as well as when selecting an item from the GtkComboBoxEntry's list.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "move-active" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkComboBox *widget, GtkScrollType scroll_type, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::move-active signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted to move the active selection.

listitem.simpara: the object that received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "popdown" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkComboBox *button, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::popdown signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted to popdown the combo box list.
The default bindings for this signal are Alt+Up and Escape.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "popup" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkComboBox *widget, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::popup signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted to popup the combo box list.
The default binding for this signal is Alt+Down.

listitem.simpara: the object that received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
